_header: And said I dread no threat
Note:
Ringler Jr. (1988)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse Printed 1476-1558. London: Mansell, 1988, TP 155.
_description: The Jeaste of Syr Gawayne — 541 lines in 6-line stanzas

BodDou261.First Lines:
…And sayde I dreede no threteI haue founde youe here in my
                    chase…
BodDou261.Last Lines:
…Come to the blysse that lasteth ayeWhere we maye here thy
                    Aungels synge
BodDou261.Note:
Transcript, c. 1564, of an early print by E.B.; beings
                    imperfectly due to loss of folios.
BodDou261.Attributed Title: Here endeth the Jeaste of Syr Gawayne (f. 25v)
